primary.$description: Use for primary text, such as sentence case headers, and buttons.

primary-inverted.$description: Use for primary text on dark or shaded surfaces.

secondary.$description: Use for secondary text such as body paragraphs.

tertiary.$description: Use for less important texts such as meta data, breadcrumbs, input field placeholder and helper text.

disabled.$description: Use for text in a disabled state.

disabled-on-surface.$description: Use for text in a disabled state but on color surfaces.

default.$description: Use to highlight titles or words on a text block.

on-surface.$description: Use it when the accent text is over a teal tinted surface (e.g. the label on a Secondary or Tertiary Button on hover state).

high-contrast.$description: Use it when the accent text needs a higher contrast against a surface (e.g. the label on a Secondary or Tertiary Button on pressed state).

default.$description: Use for critical text, such as input field error messaging.

high-contrast.$description: Use for critical text on lighter red surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for critical text on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for informational text on inline content.

high-contrast.$description: Use for informational text on lighter blue surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for informational text on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for success text on inline content.

high-contrast.$description: Use for success text on lighter surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for success text on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for warning text on inline content.

high-contrast.$description: Use for warning text on lighter orange surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for warning text on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for emphasis text on inline content.

high-contrast.$description: Use for emphasis text on lighter purple surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for emphasis text on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Default state.

hovered.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Hover state.

pressed.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Pressed state.

disabled.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Disabled state.

default-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Default state on inverted surface.

hovered-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Hover state on inverted surface.

pressed-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Pressed state on inverted surface.

disabled-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Primary Buttons on Disabled state on inverted surface.

default.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Default state.

hovered.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Hover state.

pressed.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Pressed state.

disabled.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Disabled state.

default-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Default state on inverted surfaces.

hovered-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Hover state on inverted surfaces.

pressed-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Pressed state on inverted surfaces.

disabled-inverted.$description: Use it as the fill for Secondary Buttons on Disabled state on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use it as the fill for Destructive Buttons on Default state.

hovered.$description: Use it as the fill for Destructive Buttons on Hover state.

pressed.$description: Use it as the fill for Destructive Buttons on Pressed state.

default.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Default state.

hovered.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Hover state.

pressed.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Pressed state.

disabled.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Disabled state.

default-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Default state on inverted surface.

hovered-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Hover state on inverted surface.

pressed-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Pressed state on inverted surface.

disabled-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of a Secondary Button on Disabled state on inverted surface.

default.$description: Use it in the Focus effect for the Focus state of a component.

accent.$description: Use it in the Focus effect for the Focus state of a component (highlight).

accent-inverted.$description: Use it in the Focus effect for the Focus state of a component (highlight) on solid bg.

error.$description: Use it in the Focus effect for the Error state of a component.

error-inverted.$description: Use it in the Focus effect for the Error state of a component (on dark mode).

active.$description: Use it on the Active handle of a Scrollbar component.

inactive.$description: Use it on the Inactive handle of a Scrollbar component.

default.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Default state.

default-inverted.$description: Use it for inverted input fields on inverted surface.

hover.$description: Use it for the border of an Input on hover state.

hover-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of an Input on hover state on inverted surface

active.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Active state.

active-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Active state on inverted surface.

disabled.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Disabled state.

error.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Error state.

error-inverted.$description: Use it for the border of an Input, Dropdown, Select or Text Area field on Error state on inverted surface.

default.$description: Use it for the border of an Icon Button on Default state.

hovered.$description: Use it for the border of an Icon Button on Hover state.

active.$description: Use it for the border of an Icon Button on Pressed or Active state.

subtle.$description: Use it for dividers between sections, cards, tables (e.g. separate groups on a menu, etc).

strong.$description: Use it for dividers with higher emphasis (e.g. dividers over tinted backgrounds, table cell dividers, cards).

inverted.$description: Use it for inverted dividers on solid backgrounds.

default.$description: Use it for accented icons or containers with stroke.

strong.$description: Use it for accented icons or containers with stroke that requires higher contrast.

default.$description: Use it for links on default state.

hovered.$description: Use it for links on hover state.

pressed.$description: Use it for links on pressed state.

disabled.$description: Use it for links on a disabled state.

default-inverted.$description: Use it for links on default state.

hovered-inverted.$description: Use it for links on hover state.

pressed-inverted.$description: Use it for links on pressed state.

disabled-inverted.$description: Use it for links on a disabled state.

primary.$description: Use it as the fill color for elevated elements (menus, modals, drawers, popovers, etc).

secondary.$description: Use it as the fill color for elevated elements that needs a subtle contrast against the background without the use of drop shadows (e.g. cards).

default.$description: Use it as the fill color for default interactive items (e.g. Menu items, Cards, etc).

hovered.$description: Use it as the fill color for interactive items on Hover state.

selected.$description: Use it as the fill color for interactive items on Selected state.

selected-hover.$description: Use it as the fill color for Selected interactive items on Hover state.

disabled.$description: Use it as the fill color for disabled interactive elements (e.g. a disabled option on a menu).

tinted-1.$description: Use it as the fill color for elevated elements that needs a subtle tinted contrast against the background without the use of drop shadows (banner or highlighted section container).

tinted-2.$description: Use it as the fill color for elevated elements that require a slightly higher contrast against the background (banners or highlighted sections).

overlay.$description: Use it as the dimm fill overlay for modals and other panels that needs the full focus from the user.

solid.$description: Use it as the background fill for sections that require a solid teal background (e.g full width promo banners, hero sections, etc).

subtle.$description: Use it as an alternative background fill for sections that require a subtle teal background (e.g full width promo banners, hero sections, etc).

solid.$description: Use it as the main background fill for pages and sections.

subtle.$description: Use it as an alternative background to create contrast with other cards or sections (e.g a Dashboard).

static-black.$description: Use it as a fixed dark background.

static-white.$description: Use it as a fixed white background.

solid.$description: Use it as an alternative background fill for sections that require a solid warm background (e.g full width promo banners, hero sections, etc).

subtle.$description: Use it as an alternative background fill for sections that require a subtle warm background (e.g full width promo banners, hero sections, etc).

primary.$description: Use for isolated icons with higher hierarchy

primary-inverted.$description: Use for isolated icons on dark or shaded surfaces.

secondary.$description: Use for icon buttons on default state.

tertiary.$description: Use for less important icons, that might be incorporated inline with text blocks or caption texts.

disabled-on-surface.$description: Use for icons on a disabled state but on color surfaces.

disabled.$description: Use for icons on a disabled state.

default.$description: Use to highlight icons and icon buttons on hover state.

on-surface.$description: Use to highlight icons and icon buttons on pressed state or applied over a tinted $teal surface.

high-contrast.$description: Use it to create icons with higher contrast against tinted $teal surface or pressed states.

default-inverted.$description: Use to highlight icons on inverted surfaces.

on-surface-inverted.$description: Use to highlight icons and icon buttons on pressed state on inverted surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use it to create icons with higher contrast on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use it to accompany helper texts in a component s error messages.

high-contrast.$description: Use it to accompany helper texts in a component s error messages that require higher contrast (e.g. a tinted red surface).

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use it to accompany helper texts in a component s error messages on inverted surface.

default.$description: Use for informational icons.

high-contrast.$description: Use for informational icons on lighter blue surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for informational icons on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for warning icons.

high-contrast.$description: Use for warning icons on lighter orange surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for warning icons on lighter orange surfaces.

default.$description: Use for success icons.

high-contrast.$description: Use for success icons on lighter $green surfaces.

high-contrast-inverted.$description: Use for success icons on inverted surfaces.

default.$description: Use for emphasis icons.

high-contrast.$description: Use for emphasis icons on lighter purple surfaces.

secondary.$description: Use for subtle icons on hover states.

disabled.$description: Use for subtle icons when disabled.

1.$description: These colors should not be used as part of prominent elements or sections of the interface. Their purpose is to be supportive accent colors in a dynamic composition, such as a promotional banner, an interactive chart, a discount tag, or small decorative graphic elements. Avoid using them in buttons, pages or sections background fills.

advanced-director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

consultant.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

executive-director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

national-executive-director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

senior-consultant.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

senior-director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

senior-executive-director.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

team-leader.$description: These color should only be used to represent the hierarchy of a consultant in an UI (e.g. the color fill of their Avatars).

coming-up.$description: These colors should only be used to represent the status of the party or order in Consultant's Corner. (e.g. a Status Tag or Chip).

needs-attention.$description: These colors should only be used to represent the status of the party or order in Consultant's Corner. (e.g. a Status Tag or Chip).

open.$description: These colors should only be used to represent the status of the party or order in Consultant's Corner. (e.g. a Status Tag or Chip).

submitted.$description: These colors should only be used to represent the status of the party or order in Consultant's Corner. (e.g. a Status Tag or Chip).

unsubmitted.$description: These colors should only be used to represent the status of the party or order in Consultant's Corner. (e.g. a Status Tag or Chip).

graphic.$description: Color fill of graphic elements on selected theme (Illustration).
Color fill of graphic elements on selected theme (Illustration).
Color fill of graphic elements on selected theme (Illustration).
Color fill of graphic elements on selected theme (Illustration).

none.$description: (0px). Use when elements should have no gap or padding between them (e.g both consecutive sections have white bg, so the next section will have a 0px top padding to avoid an excessive spacing).

2xs.$description: (4px). Use for very tight spacing like icon-to-text gaps or subtle padding.

xs.$description: (8px). Use for compact component internal spacing or small gaps between related elements.

sm.$description: (12px). Use for moderate padding within components or gaps between closely related items.

md.$description: (16px). Default spacing for most component padding and gaps. Our baseline spacing unit.

lg.$description: (24px). Use for generous component padding or gaps between distinct sections.

xl.$description: (32px). Use for significant separation between components or section padding.

2xl.$description: (40px). Use for separation between content blocks within a section.

3xl.$description: (48px). Use for vertical separation between sections.

4xl.$description: (64px). Use for maximum spacing between distinct page areas or special layout needs.

square.$description: Sharp corners with no rounding (0px). Use for rectangular elements requiring hard edges.

sm.$description: Small corner radius (6px). Use for subtle rounding on cards and other UI elements.

md.$description: Medium corner radius (8px). Standard rounding for most components like inputs, bigger cards, and containers.

xl.$description: Use it only for Search Typeahead menus and pill shaped items (e.g Quantity Stepper).

full.$description: Creates fully rounded borders (pill-shaped buttons, circular avatars). Outputs as 50% in CSS. The 1000px Figma value is a placeholderactual roundness is percentage-based.

xs.$description: (24px). Use as the base icon height and smaller elements.

sm.$description: (32px). Use it as the fixed height for Small Buttons and sm variants.

md.$description: (40px). Fixed height for Input/Text fields and default Chips (md).

lg.$description: (48px). Fixed height for Large Buttons, Input/Text fields, and other large component variants (lg).

xl.$description: (72px). Height for xl icon buttons and chips.

xs.$description: (16px). Height for the smallest icon size (Small Button).

sm.$description: (20px). Height for the icon in a Large Button.

md.$description: (24px). Default size for most standalone icons and instances in icon buttons.

lg.$description: (32px). Default size for most standalone icons and instances in icon buttons.

2xl.$description: (64px). Default size for most standalone icons and instances in icon buttons.

4xl.$description: (80px). Max height of a highlighted icon (e.g. a more detailed icon of a feature of benefit on a landing page).

button-mw-sm.$description: (96px). Ensures small buttons have adequate clickable area and visual presence.

button-mw-lg.$description: (128px). Ensures large buttons have substantial clickable area and prominent visual hierarchy.

bottom-sheet.$description: $elevation-component-bottom-sheet  Bottom sheets, fixed elements to the bottom.

bottom-right.$description: $elevation-component-bottom-right  Highlighted card overlays on the bottom right corner.

sm.$description: Subtle elevation, tooltips, cards.

md.$description: Dropdown menus.

primary.$description: Use it for the primary typography styles (Displays, headings).

secondary.$description: Use it for the secondary typography styles (labels, body copy, captions, etc).

uppercase.$description: Use it only for the Eyebrow typography style.

line-through.$description: Use it for the discounted price (text-strikethrough styles).

xl.$description: $desktop-typography-display-xl  Use for the largest display text in hero sections and major headings.

lg.$description: $desktop-typography-display-lg  Use for large display text in prominent hero sections.

md.$description: $desktop-typography-display-md  Use for medium display text in featured sections and banners.

sm.$description: $desktop-typography-display-sm  Use for smaller display text in secondary hero sections.

xs.$description: $desktop-typography-display-xs  Use for the smallest display text in tertiary featured content.

xl.$description: $desktop-typography-headline-xl  Use for extra large section headlines and page titles.

lg.$description: $desktop-typography-headline-lg  Use for large section headlines and major content groupings.

md.$description: $desktop-typography-headline-md  Use for medium section headlines and subsection titles.

sm.$description: $desktop-typography-headline-sm  Use for small section headlines and card titles.

lg.$description: $desktop-typography-price-lg  Use to display current products PDP.

lg-strikethrough.$description: $desktop-typography-price-lg-strikethrough  Use for display previous products price on PDP.

md.$description: $desktop-typography-price-md  Use to display current products price on standard product cards.

md-strikethrough.$description: $desktop-typography-price-md-strikethrough  Use to display previous products price on standard product cards.

sm.$description: $desktop-typography-price-sm  Use for small pricing display in compact layouts.

sm-strikethrough.$description: $desktop-typography-price-sm-strikethrough  Use for small crossed-out original prices in compact views.

regular.$description: $desktop-typography-text-xl-regular   Use for extra large body text in introductory paragraphs.

bold.$description: $desktop-typography-text-xl-bold  Use for emphasized extra large body text.

underline.$description: $desktop-typography-text-xl-underline  Use for underlined extra large text links.

regular.$description: $desktop-typography-text-lg-regular  Use for large body text in feature descriptions.

bold.$description: $desktop-typography-text-lg-bold  Use for emphasized large body text and subheadings.

underline.$description: $desktop-typography-text-lg-underline  Use for underlined large text links.

regular.$description: $desktop-typography-text-md-regular  Use for standard body text and paragraph content.

bold.$description: $desktop-typography-text-md-bold  Use for emphasized medium body text and inline headings.

underline.$description: $desktop-typography-text-md-underline  Use for underlined medium text links.

regular.$description: $desktop-typography-text-sm-regular  Use for small body text captions and secondary information.

bold.$description: $desktop-typography-text-sm-bold  Use for emphasized small text and labels.

underline.$description: $desktop-typography-text-sm-underline  Use for underlined small text links and footnotes.

md.$description: $desktop-typography-utility-cta-md  Use for for lg buttons.

sm.$description: $desktop-typography-utility-cta-sm  Use for sm buttons.

eyebrow.$description: $desktop-typography-utility-eyebrow  Use for small uppercase labels above headlines and sections.

xl.$description: $desktop-section-padding-vertical-xl  Use for extra large vertical spacing in hero and feature sections.

lg.$description: $desktop-section-padding-vertical-lg  Use for default vertical spacing (top and bottom padding) in major sections.

md.$description: $desktop-section-padding-vertical-md  Use for medium vertical spacing in standard sections.

sm.$description: $desktop-section-padding-vertical-sm  Use for small vertical spacing in compact sections.

xs.$description: $desktop-section-padding-vertical-xs  Use for extra small vertical spacing in tight layouts. Apply to top/bottom padding for adjacent sections with white bg.

lg.$description: $desktop-section-padding-horizontal-lg  Default horizontal padding for main content areas.

md.$description: $desktop-section-padding-horizontal-md  Use for medium horizontal padding in standard containers.

sm.$description: $desktop-section-padding-horizontal-sm  Use for small horizontal padding in narrow containers.

xs.$description: $desktop-section-padding-horizontal-xs  Use for extra small horizontal padding in compact layouts.

sm.$description: Text sm, CTA sm, Eyebrow

md.$description: Text md, CTA md

xl.$description: $mobile-section-padding-vertical-xl  Use for extra large vertical spacing in hero and feature sections.

lg.$description: $mobile-section-padding-vertical-lg  Use for default vertical spacing (top and bottom padding) in major sections.

md.$description: $mobile-section-padding-vertical-md  Use for medium vertical spacing in standard sections.

sm.$description: $mobile-section-padding-vertical-sm  Use for small vertical spacing in compact sections.

xs.$description: $mobile-section-padding-vertical-xs  Use for extra small vertical spacing in tight layouts. Apply to top/bottom padding for adjacent sections with white bg.

lg.$description: $mobile-section-padding-horizontal-lg  Default horizontal padding for main content areas.

md.$description: $mobile-section-padding-horizontal-md  Use for medium horizontal padding in standard containers.

sm.$description: $mobile-section-padding-horizontal-sm  Use for small horizontal padding in narrow containers.

xs.$description: $mobile-section-padding-horizontal-xs  Use for extra small horizontal padding in compact layouts.

sm.$description: Text sm, CTA sm, Eyebrow

md.$description: Text md, CTA md

xl.$description: $mobile-typography-display-xl  Use for the largest display text in hero sections and major headings.

lg.$description: $mobile-typography-display-lg  Use for large display text in prominent hero sections.

md.$description: $mobile-typography-display-md  Use for medium display text in featured sections and banners.

md.$description: $mobile-typography-headline-md  Use for medium section headlines and subsection titles.

sm.$description: $mobile-typography-headline-sm  Use for small section headlines and card titles.

lg.$description: $mobile-typography-price-lg  Use to display current product's PDP.

lg-strikethrough.$description: $mobile-typography-price-lg-strikethrough  Use for display previous product's price on PDP.

md.$description: $mobile-typography-price-md  Use to display current product's price on standard product cards.

md-strikethrough.$description: $mobile-typography-price-md-strikethrough  Use to display previous product's price on standard product cards.

sm.$description: $mobile-typography-price-sm  Use for small pricing display in compact layouts.

sm-strikethrough.$description: $mobile-typography-price-sm-strikethrough  Use for small crossed-out original prices in compact views.

regular.$description: $mobile-typography-text-xl-regular   Use for extra large body text in introductory paragraphs.

bold.$description: $mobile-typography-text-xl-bold  Use for emphasized extra large body text.

underline.$description: $mobile-typography-text-xl-underline  Use for underlined extra large text links.

regular.$description: $mobile-typography-text-lg-regular  Use for large body text in feature descriptions.

bold.$description: $mobile-typography-text-lg-bold  Use for emphasized large body text and subheadings.

underline.$description: $mobile-typography-text-lg-underline  Use for underlined large text links.

regular.$description: $mobile-typography-text-md-regular  Use for standard body text and paragraph content.

bold.$description: $mobile-typography-text-md-bold  Use for emphasized medium body text and inline headings.

underline.$description: $mobile-typography-text-md-underline  Use for underlined medium text links.

regular.$description: $mobile-typography-text-sm-regular  Use for small body text captions and secondary information.

bold.$description: $mobile-typography-text-sm-bold  Use for emphasized small text and labels.

underline.$description: $mobile-typography-text-sm-underline  Use for underlined small text links and footnotes.

md.$description: $mobile-typography-utility-cta-md  Use for for lg buttons.

sm.$description: $mobile-typography-utility-cta-sm  Use for sm buttons.

eyebrow.$description: $mobile-typography-utility-eyebrow  Use for small uppercase labels above headlines and sections.

sm.$description: 576-767px - Phablets and small tablets

md.$description: 768-991px - Tablets, windowed display

xl.$description: 1200-1727px - Computers, laptops, premium tablets, folding phones (HD/FHD)

1:1.$description: Square aspect ratio. Default illustrations, product or recipe thumbnail, also used for avatar pictures.

3:2.$description: Horizontal 3:2 aspect ratio. Use it for illustrations or images on mobile, it's not restricted for desktop either.

16:9.$description: Horizontal 16:9 aspect ratio. Use it for featured images or product shots (mostly sets) where the cropping area affects visibility of the entire image.

4:3.$description: Horizontal 4:3. Default use for single images on Hero sections.

1:1.$description: Square aspect ratio. Default illustrations, product or recipe thumbnail, also used for avatar pictures.

default.$description: Use for default focus ring.

default-inverted.$description: Use for default focus ring on inverted surfaces.

accent.$description: Use for the focus ring of highlighted components.

error.$description: Use for the focus ring of error state components.

error-inverted.$description: Use for the focus ring of error state components on inverted surfaces.
